page.title: 11HOUSING DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Many of the properties are occupied as retirement homes, since they are of a detached nature, with the previously mentioned predominance of bungalows and the preference of people of pensionable age to live on or near coastal sites. The area bounded by the railway line and the coast, known as 'within the gates' is also popular as a location for the retirement homes of professional workers and managers. Development in Walton, principally Frinton Homelands and Meers Farm Estate, connects with housing outside Frinton's railway gates and creates no real separation between the twin settlements. The Thorpe-le-Soken to Walton railway line, having stations at Kirby Cross, Frinton and Walton, forms a barrier which helps to retain the individuality of the
